title: Light Weight Perlite Concrete
description:
INTRODUCTION :
PERLITE is not a trade name but a generic term for naturally occurring siliceous volcanic rock, which when heated in excess of 870 0C, expands four to twenty times its original volume and is transformed into lightweight glass-like particles containing countless sealed cells. This unique structure accounts for its superior insulating characteristics.
  PERLIMIX is a light weight Perlite based aggregate which when combined with portland cement and water produces an ultra light weight concrete that is used for insulating roof decks and lightweight floor fills, insulating structural rock decks, curtain wall systems and for a variety of permanent insulating applications.
  PERLITE-MIX is a very unique insulating material especially when studied in comparison with other conventional insulating materials e.g. Vermiculite, EPS, PUF etc. All the insulating materials are either used for cold (cryogenic) or hot (thermal), whereas Perlite is the only insulating material which is used for both cold as well as hot insulation.
 Note :
Water should be clean and free of deleterious substances. AEA is used in Perlimix to reduce segregation and entrain air out. The use of AEA must be carefully controlled to accomplish the desired results without reducing the strength of the concrete. We recommend water proofing over the light weight Perliteimix cement concrete. One can apply normal roofing materials like Mosaic Tiles, PCC, Tiles etc. over the Perlite-mix insulation layer.
Ø PRODUCT / APPLICATION FEATURES.
  v Light weight.
v Energy saving.
v Chemically Inert.
v Adaptable on curved surfaces.
v Excellent workability,
Monolithic surface.
v Excellent roofing substrate.
v Fire retardant & non-combustible.
v Slope to drain.
v Durable and permanent.
  v No asbestos.

title: Gray PQC M40 Ready Mix Concrete, For Construction, Packaging Type: Loose
description: PQC M40 Ready Mix Concrete is a high-strength, premium quality concrete designed for pavement quality concrete applications. It has a compressive strength of 40 MPG (Mega Pascal) and is formulated with high-quality cement, aggregates, and admixtures. This concrete mix is ideal for high-traffic roads, highways, and airport pavements, offering excellent durability, resistance to heavy loads, and weathering. PQC M40 Ready Mix Concrete meets international quality standards and is certified by relevant authorities, ensuring consistent performance and reliability in demanding infrastructure projects.

title: Dry Lean Concrete, Packaging Type: Loose
description: Dry Lean Concrete (DLC) is a type of concrete with a low cement content, primarily used as a base or sub-base for rigid pavements like roads and pavements. It's characterized by a higher proportion of aggregates (gravel, crushed stone, etc.) compared to conventional concrete, making it less dense and more suitable for foundation support.

title: Renderoc RGL Cementitious Micro Concrete

details.usage/application: Particularly where access is restricted & where vibration of the placed material is difficult

description: Renderoc RG(L)  is supplied as a ready to use blend of drypowder, which requires only the site addition of clean water to produce  a  free-flowing, non-shrink microconcrete.    Thematerial is based on Portland cements, and fillers, and additives which impart controlled expansion characteristics in the plastic state, while minimising water demand. The low water requirement ensures high early strength and long term durability. For larger repairs, Renderoc RG(L) may be modified by the addition of 5mm to 12mm  clean, graded saturated surface dry aggregates at site. For exceptionally large  repairs, the local Fosroc office should be consulted.

title: SikaEmaco S 466 Micro Concrete, Packaging Size: 25 kg
description:
MasterEmaco® S 466 (formerly known as Emaco S66 T)
High Strength dual shrinkage compensated, flowable micro concrete for concrete repairs
DESCRIPTIONMasterEmaco S 466 micro concrete pourable mortar is a dual shrinkage compensated, high flow, high strength formulation for structural concrete repairs.
 MasterEmaco S 466 is suitable for placing in thicknesses of 25mm to 200 mm. MasterEmaco S 466 provides a durable, strong structural repair fully compatible with host concrete.
RECOMMENDED USES MasterEmaco S 466 is the ideal material for vertical or horizontal structural repairs where the thickness of repair is more than 25mm and use of pourable mortar is preferable to hand or machine applied repair systems.
